headline: Blue Ribbon cites Curlee Discaya in contempt over lying about wife's absence
author: By LLANESCA T. PANTI, GMA Integrated News
contentt:
The Senate blue ribbon committee on Thursday cited contractor Pacifico "Curlee" Discaya II in contempt for lying about the absence of his wife, Sarah, during the probe into the anomalous government flood control projects.

The Blue Ribbon committee approved the motion put forward by Senator Raffy Tulfo to cite Curlee Discaya in contempt after he told the committee that his wife and business partner, Sarah, skipped the probe due to a "heart condition."

Senate Pro Tempore Panfilo Lacson, committee chairman, then read the letter sent by Sarah to the panel that she cannot attend due to a pre-scheduled meeting with her employees.

"Niloloko mo kami. You lied!" Senator Erwin Tulfo said.

Asked to explain his answer, Mr. Discaya said his wife also has diabetes and hypertension too.

"Marami po siyang maintenance na gamot na ginagamit," he said.

At this point, the Senate blue ribbon panel had enough and carried the motion to cite Mr. Discaya in contempt.—AOL, GMA Integrated News

author: By GMA Integrated News
contentt:

headline: Marcos thanks UAE over support for Filipino workers
author: By ANNA FELICIA BAJO, GMA Integrated News
contentt:
President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. expressed appreciation to the government of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) for its support for Filipino workers and for making the Philippines a partner in various mutually beneficial undertakings.

An official delegation from the UAE led by Deputy Minister of Cabinet Affairs for Competitiveness and Experience Exchange, Abdulla Nasser Lootah, paid a courtesy call on the President on Thursday.

''It was a pleasure to welcome Deputy Minister Abdulla Nasser Lootah and the UAE delegation as they conclude the Philippines–UAE Government Experience Exchange Forum,'' Marcos said in a social media post.

''We are grateful to the UAE for its continued support to our Filipino workers and for being a true partner in building smarter, future-ready governments. Through shared knowledge and collaboration, we are creating meaningful change for our people,'' he added.

Deputy Minister Lootah was accompanied by UAE Ambassador to the Philippines Mohamed Obaid Salem Alqataam Alzaabi as well as other UAE officials.

During the meeting with the Philippine president, Lootah expressed the UAE government's interest in strengthening the bilateral ties between the Philippines and the UAE, citing its importance.

The Philippines and UAE Government Experience Exchange Forum seeks to capacitate government personnel from both countries through sharing of government experiences and best practices. —VAL, GMA Integrated News

headline: Magnitude 5.5 earthquake strikes La Union
author: By GMA Integrated News
contentt:
A magnitude 5.5 earthquake struck La Union before dawn Friday and was felt in nearby provinces.

According to the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology, the epicenter was located 49 km northwest of Luna, La Union at a depth of 17 km.
